events.name: Friday Hacks #120: Building scalable advertising platforms
events.description:
Building scalable advertising platforms

Talk Description:

Sean is excited to be at Friday Hacks to talk about his experience building revenue products for Twitter. In what may be an ambitious use of his allotted time, he will attempt to whiteboard a design for a scalable, real-time advertising platform.

Speaker Profile

Sean is a product-minded engineer who believes that things don’t just happen if you don’t make them happen. He is currently the tech lead for performance advertising products at Twitter, which he joined through the acquisition of TellApart, an advertising technology startup. Prior to TellApart, he was one of the early engineers at ReferralCandy. Sean is a graduate of Brown University.
events.location: SR3, Town Plaza, University Town, NUS, , Singapore

events.name: ProductTank #5: Impact Mapping with Gojko Adzic
events.description:
This time, ProductTank Singapore is doing something different. Gojko Adzic, world-class speaker on product and lean innovation will be in Singapore, and he kindly agreed to give a talk at ProductTank. You don't want to miss this one! 


THEME: IMPACT MAPPING WITH INNOVATION GAMES Impact Mapping is a lightweight method for strategic planning in product and project development. Although seemingly simple and intuitive, many teams fail to get the most out of it because they jump to conclusions too quickly and skip over important discussions.  Our guest, Gojko Adzic, will talk about how to avoid common pitfalls and present two innovation games that can help you facilitate impact mapping easily, support innovative ideas and divergent thinking, and help your teams and clients make a big impact through software delivery. 


Recommended reading:  Impact Mapping: Making a Big Impact with Software Products and Projects. (See it on Amazon.) 


HOW TO RSVP: Due to the requirements of the building's security, attendees have to RSVP using their real names. Please RSVP via Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/producttank-5-impact-mapping-with-gojko-adzic-tickets-27795869193 



ABOUT GOJKO ADZIC Gojko Adzic is a strategic software delivery consultant who works with ambitious teams to align software delivery with business goals, and improve the quality of their software products and processes. Gojko specialises in agile and lean quality improvement, impact mapping, agile testing, specification by example, and behaviour-driven development.  Gojko’s book Specification by Example won the Jolt Award for the best book of 2012. In 2011, he was voted by peers as the most influential agile testing professional, and his blog won the UK Agile Award for the best online publication in 2010. Gojko is a frequent keynote speaker at leading software development conferences, and one of the authors of MindMup and Claudia.js. 


AGENDA 18:30 - Registration starts. 19:00 - Registration ends. 19:00 - Quick intro about ProductTank. 19:05 - 19:45 (approx.) - Gojko to do his magic. 19:45 - 20:00 - Q&A 20:00 - 21:00 - Networking. 21:00 - Event ends. 


Notes: • The exact schedule is subject to change, but we’ll definitely start by 7pm. • RSVPs will close at 01:00am on Wednesday, October 5. • Remember to bring your ID for a smooth check-in with the building security. :) • IMPORTANT: Please be on time. Registration will close at 7pm, and in case you're late, you won't be able to enter until the end of Gojko's talk.

events.name: Bot Framework, Cognitive Services & Azure IoT Workshop
events.description:
Using Microsoft Bot Framework, you can build and connect intelligent bots to interact with your users naturally wherever they are, from text/SMS to Skype, Slack, Office 365 mail and other popular services.

With Microsoft Cognitive Services, your applications can integrate vision, speech, language, knowledge, and search APIs made to work on platform of your choice.

Azure IoT Suite brings the Internet of your things to life. You can connect your devices, analyse previously-untapped data, and integrate business system to transform your company when you uncover new business models and revenue streams.

The speakers, James Lee & Shawn Tjai, are Technical Evangelists @ Microsoft.

Sign up for this or any of the other $PATH to iNTUition workshops at https://ieeentu.typeform.com/to/SAqemr.

events.name: Let's meet to share about improvised lab equipment and home experiments
events.description: This is the third of our monthly events. We had previously met at NUS and SUTD campuses. This time we will move to the west, to a brand new research centre and part of Singapore's latest medical school. Our programme: 1. Biomedicine and Art exhibition2. Aspergillus and fungi in our environment talk3. Tour of a working Research Lab4. Discussion about Citizen Science projects for OpenBio More info at: www.OpenBio.asia (http://www.openbio.asia/)
events.location: Nanyang Technological University, Nanyang Drive, Singapore

events.name: Future of Giving: What Do You Know About Inclusive Design?
events.description:
October is all about the Future of Giving! Sustainable Living Lab and (these)abilities will be examining the trends affecting what motivates volunteers, experimenting with different messages to engage them and exploring how cutting edge technologies can help create strong volunteer relationships. Whether you are a volunteer, a volunteer manager or simply curious, you can’t miss this! At the end of this series, we hope that you will understand and be inspired by the principles behind inclusive design. We also hope that whether you are a volunteer or a volunteer manager you will walk away with a toolkit that will help you to manage volunteer relationships better.

In this first session, we will be getting to understand the challenges that (these)abilities faces -- how might we as able-bodied persons understand the challenges in creating inclusive design? What motivates or frustrates someone to work in this space? Do we know if we are respectful of our fellow volunteers' gifts and talents? 

Come join us this Friday with your curiosity and find out! 

== 
Please note the location -- we will be meeting at the Community Lab at UWCSEA Tampines. Please write in to chewlin.kay@sl2square.org to register -- we will be writing to registered participants on Thursday with directions.
events.location: Sustainable Living Lab (SL2), 1 Tampines Street 73, Singapore 528704
